TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ObjectContext extends System.Object implements class System.IDisposable

summary.span: 提供以对象形式查询和使用实体数据的功能。

span.span: Provides facilities for querying and working with entity data as objects.

remarks.format: ## Remarks > [!NOTE] > 类不是线程安全的。The class is not thread safe. 中的数据对象的完整性无法确保在多线程方案。The integrity of data objects in an cannot be ensured in multithreaded scenarios. 类是用于为是在概念模型中定义的实体类型的实例的对象与数据交互的主类。The class is the primary class for interacting with data as objects that are instances of entity types that are defined in a conceptual model. 类的实例包装以下内容：An instance of the class encapsulates the following: - 到数据库的连接，以 对象的形式包装。A connection to the database, in the form of an object. - 描述模型的元数据，以 对象的形式包装。Metadata that describes the model, in the form of a object. - 用来管理保存在缓存中的对象的 对象。An object that manages objects persisted in the cache. 如果表示概念模型的对象层由 Entity Data Model 工具生成的表示类模型派生自。When the object layer that represents a conceptual model is generated by the Entity Data Model tools, the class that represents the for the model is derived from the . ## Examples 此示例基于[AdventureWorks 销售模型](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/f16cd988-673f-4376-b034-129ca93c7832)。This example is based on the [AdventureWorks Sales Model](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/f16cd988-673f-4376-b034-129ca93c7832). 该示例演示如何构造 。The example shows you how to construct an . summary.span: 接受在对象上下文中对对象所做的所有更改。

span.span: Accepts all changes made to objects in the object context.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 接受 中所有关联项上的更改，因此这些项的结果状态为未更改或已分离。Accepts the changes on all associated entries in the so their resultant state is either unchanged or detached. 此方法循环访问 中所有为 Added 或 Modified 的 对象，然后将项的状态设置为 Unchanged。This method iterates all the objects within the that are Added or Modified, and then sets the state of the entry to Unchanged. Deleted 项变为已分离的。The Deleted items become detached. 如果调用了方法和未指定，用户必须调用方法。If the method was called and the was not specified, the user must call the method. 如果事务失败而用户希望重试， 方法就很有用。The method is useful in the scenario where a transaction has failed and a user wants to retry.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 调用 的 可将对象添加到对象上下文。Call on the to add the object to the object context. 当对象为数据源中尚不存在的新对象时采用此方法。Do this when the object is a new object that does not yet exist in the data source. 有关详细信息，请参阅[附加和分离对象](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/41d5c1ef-1b78-4502-aa10-7e1438d62d23)。For more information, see [Attaching and Detaching Objects](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/41d5c1ef-1b78-4502-aa10-7e1438d62d23). 对象以 、 或 状态添加到 。Objects are added to the in the , or state. 在创建与对象上下文中的另一个对象相关的新对象时，通过使用下列方法之一添加该新对象：When you create a new object that is related to another object in the object context, add the object by using one of the following methods: - 调用 的 方法并指定相关对象。Call the method on the and specify the related object. 此方法适用于一对多或多对多关系。Do this for a one-to-many or many-to-many relationship. - 将 的 属性设置为相关对象。Set the property of the to the related object. 此方法适用于一对一或多对一关系。Do this for a one-to-one or many-to-one relationship. 有关详细信息，请参阅[创建、 添加、 修改，和删除对象](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/f76f1fad-c553-4b59-820b-89b3dec2fad1)。For more information, see [Creating, Adding, Modifying, and Deleting Objects](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/f76f1fad-c553-4b59-820b-89b3dec2fad1). 如果此对象处于 detached 状态，它必须不具有。If the object is in a detached state it must not have an . 为规则`entitySetName`格式如下所示：The rules for the `entitySetName` format are as follows: - 如果属性是`null`，则`entitySetName`必须是完全限定作为 in *\<实体容器名称 >*。*\<实体集名称 >*。If the property is `null`, then the `entitySetName` has to be fully qualified as in *\*.*\*. - 如果不`null`，则`entitySetName`可以是*\<实体容器名称 >*。*\<实体集名称 >* 或*\<实体集名称 >*。If is not `null`, then the `entitySetName` can be either *\*.*\* or *\*. 如果`object`具有和`entitySetName`具有一个值，则密钥必须与匹配的实体根据已找到`entitySetName`和实体容器名称。If the `object` has an and `entitySetName` has a value, then the of the entity key must match the that was found based on the `entitySetName` and entity container name. ## Examples 此示例基于[AdventureWorks 销售模型](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/f16cd988-673f-4376-b034-129ca93c7832)。This example is based on the [AdventureWorks Sales Model](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/f16cd988-673f-4376-b034-129ca93c7832). 示例添加一个新的产品，并将所做的更改保存到数据库。The example adds a new product and saves the changes to the database. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法用于将对之外的对象所做的更改应用，例如，Web 服务接收的已分离对象。The method is used to apply changes that were made to objects outside the , such as detached objects that are received by a Web service. 该方法将标量值从提供的对象复制到中的对象中具有相同的键。The method copies the scalar values from the supplied object into the object in the that has the same key. 你可以使用要从数据源中检索此对象的实例的已分离对象。You can use the of the detached object to retrieve an instance of this object from the data source. 有关详细信息，请参阅[如何： 返回特定对象使用其密钥](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/2e9902af-29b0-4e5d-92db-03dfe6ec49bd)。For more information, see [How to: Return a Specific Object Using its Key](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/2e9902af-29b0-4e5d-92db-03dfe6ec49bd). 任何与不同值的对象的原始值都标记为已修改。Any values that differ from the original values of the object are marked as modified. 请注意，该方法不适用于当前值的相关对象`currentEntity`。Note, the method does not apply the current values to the related objects of `currentEntity`. 如果你有与当前值的关系图，并想要应用的原始值，调用方法。If you have a graph with the current values and want to apply the original values, call method. 你还可以使用的或方法。You may also use the of the or method of the . 有关详细信息，请参阅[生成 N 层应用程序](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/9439d2ba-6b5f-44e8-be65-8a442d922cbb)。For more information, see [Building N-Tier Applications](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/9439d2ba-6b5f-44e8-be65-8a442d922cbb).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法用于将已修改、已分离版本的对象的属性更改应用于附加到 的原始版本。The method is used to apply property changes from a modified, detached version of an object to the original version attached to the . 这样可支持 Web 服务等方案，这些方案将实体对象分离并发送至属性已更新的远程应用程序。This supports scenarios, such as Web services, where an entity object is detached and sent to a remote application where property updates are made. 使用此方法可以更加方便地将这些更改应用回原始对象。This method enables you to more easily apply these changes back to the original object. 在执行 之后，对象处于 状态。After , the object is in the state. 必须调用 方法来更新数据源。You must call the method to update the data source. 原始对象必须存在于 中，并且必须处于 或 状态。The original object must exist in the and must be in the or state. 如果已修改的属性中，仅修改原始对象`changed`对象。The original object is only modified if there are modified properties in the `changed` object. 提供对象的 属性必须设置为有效的 。The property of the supplied object must be set to a valid . 不影响导航属性或相关对象。 does not affect navigation properties or related objects. 仅设置类型的实体元数据中存在的属性。 only sets properties that exist in the entity metadata for the type. 例如， 操作不涉及在分部类中添加的属性。For example, properties that are added in a partial class are not included in the operation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 调用 的 可将对象附加到对象上下文。Call on the to attach the object to the object context. 当对象已存在于数据源中但当前尚未附加到上下文时采用此方法。Do this when the object already exists in the data source but is currently not attached to the context. 有关详细信息，请参阅[自定义对象](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/af6f07ce-2261-4c65-87cf-d018ad082921)。For more information, see [Customizing Objects](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/af6f07ce-2261-4c65-87cf-d018ad082921). 用于附加对象或对象图中的顶层对象。 is used to attach an object or the top-level object in an object graph. 要附加的对象必须实现 以公开 。The object being attached must implement to expose an . 所有生成的实体类都实现 。All generated entity classes implement . 将相关的对象的连接时，你还必须调用`Attach`上或定义的关系。When you attach related objects, you must also call `Attach` on the or the to define the relationship. 此方法调用 方法。This method calls the method. 在附加对象时需要考虑下列注意事项：The following considerations apply when attaching objects: - 如果要附加的对象具有相关对象，则这些对象也会附加到对象上下文。If the object being attached has related objects, those objects will also be attached to the object context. - 对象以未更改状态添加到对象上下文。Objects are added to the object context in an unchanged state. - 传递到 方法的对象必须具有有效的 值。The object that is passed to the method must have a valid value. 如果对象没有有效的 值，请使用 方法指定实体集的名称。If the object does not have a valid value, use the method to specify the name of the entity set. ## Examples 本主题中的示例基于[AdventureWorks 销售模型](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/f16cd988-673f-4376-b034-129ca93c7832)。The example in this topic is based on the [AdventureWorks Sales Model](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/f16cd988-673f-4376-b034-129ca93c7832). 在此示例中，附加了两个对象，然后定义了关系。In this example, two objects are attached and then the relationship is defined. [!code-csharp[DP ObjectServices Concepts#AttachRelatedObjects](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Data/DP ObjectServices Concepts/CS/Source.cs#attachrelatedobjects)] [!code-vb[DP ObjectServices Concepts#AttachRelatedObjects](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Data/DP ObjectServices Concepts/VB/Source.vb#attachrelatedobjects)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 调用上将对象附加到对象上下文中设置的特定实体或如果该对象具有`null`(`Nothing`在 Visual Basic 中)值。Call on the to attach the object to a specific entity set in the object context or if the object has a `null` (`Nothing` in Visual Basic) value. 有关详细信息，请参阅[附加和分离对象](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/41d5c1ef-1b78-4502-aa10-7e1438d62d23)。For more information, see [Attaching and Detaching Objects](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/41d5c1ef-1b78-4502-aa10-7e1438d62d23). 要附加的对象可以是单个对象，也可以是对象图的一部分。The object being attached can be a single object or be part of the graph. 为规则`entitySetName`格式如下所示：The rules for the `entitySetName` format are as follows: - 如果属性是`null`，则`entitySetName`必须是完全限定作为 in *\<实体容器名称 >*。*\<实体集名称 >*。If the property is `null`, then the `entitySetName` has to be fully qualified as in *\*.*\*. - 如果不`null`，则`entitySetName`可以是*\<实体容器名称 >*。*\<实体集名称 >* 或*\<实体集名称 >*。If the is not `null`, then the `entitySetName` can be either *\*.*\* or *\*. 要附加的对象不需要 与其关联。The object being attached is not required to have an associated with it. 如果对象不具有实体键，然后`entitySetName`不能为空字符串。If the object does not have an entity key, then `entitySetName` cannot be an empty string. 如果要附加的对象具有和`entitySetName`具有一个值，则密钥必须与匹配的实体根据已找到`entitySetName`和实体容器名称。If the object being attached has an and `entitySetName` has a value, then the of the entity key must match the that was found based on the `entitySetName` and entity container name.

summary.span: 标记对象以备删除。

span.span: Marks an object for deletion.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 从 中标记对象以备删除。Marks an object for deletion from the . 当调用 方法时，在数据源中删除该对象。The object is deleted in the data source when the method is called. 删除父对象也会删除约束关系中的所有子对象。Deleting the parent object also deletes all the child objects in the constrained relationship. 此结果与启用关系的关联上的 `CascadeDelete` 属性相同。This result is the same as enabling the `CascadeDelete` property on the association for the relationship. 可以对已删除的对象调用方法。The method can be called on objects that are already deleted. ## Examples 这些示例基于[AdventureWorks 销售模型](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/f16cd988-673f-4376-b034-129ca93c7832)。These examples are based on the [AdventureWorks Sales Model](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/f16cd988-673f-4376-b034-129ca93c7832). 此示例构造使用特定 ProductID，使用密钥来从数据源中检索产品对象、 删除产品，并将所做的更改保存到数据库。This example constructs an with a specific ProductID, uses the key to retrieve a Product object from the data source, deletes the product, and saves the changes to the database. [!code-csharp[DP ObjectServices Concepts#DeleteObject](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Data/DP ObjectServices Concepts/CS/Source.cs#deleteobject)] [!code-vb[DP ObjectServices Concepts#DeleteObject](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Data/DP ObjectServices Concepts/VB/Source.vb#deleteobject)] 此示例删除一个现有订单项，添加一个新的项，并将所做的更改保存到数据库。This example deletes an existing order item, adds a new item, and saves the changes to the database. [!code-csharp[DP ObjectServices Concepts#SaveChanges](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Data/DP ObjectServices Concepts/CS/Source.cs#savechanges)] [!code-vb[DP ObjectServices Concepts#SaveChanges](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Data/DP ObjectServices Concepts/VB/Source.vb#savechanges)]

summary.span: 从对象上下文移除对象。

span.span: Removes the object from the object context.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 从 移除对象。Removes the object from the . 这会禁用对该对象的更改跟踪和标识解析。This disables change tracking and identity resolution for that object. 有关详细信息，请参阅[附加和分离对象](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/41d5c1ef-1b78-4502-aa10-7e1438d62d23)。For more information, see [Attaching and Detaching Objects](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/41d5c1ef-1b78-4502-aa10-7e1438d62d23). 调用 方法后，系统将不再保留指向此对象的引用，此对象可由垃圾回收器收集。After the method is called, the system will no longer keep references that point to this object and it can be collected by the garbage collector. > [!NOTE] > 仅当用户代码不包含对已分离对象的任何引用时，才进行垃圾回收。Garbage collection can only occur if the user code does not have any references to the detached object. 在分离对象时，应考虑以下注意事项：The following considerations apply when detaching objects: - 仅影响传递给方法的特定对象。 only affects the specific object that is passed to the method. 如果要分离的对象在对象上下文中具有相关对象，则那些相关对象不会分离。If the object being detached has related objects in the object context, those objects are not detached. - 分离对象不影响数据源中的数据。Detaching objects does not affect data in the data source. - 在分离操作过程中不会强制执行级联删除指令和引用约束。Cascade delete directives and referential constraints are not enforced during a detach operation. 有关详细信息，请参阅[附加和分离对象](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/41d5c1ef-1b78-4502-aa10-7e1438d62d23)。For more information, see [Attaching and Detaching Objects](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/41d5c1ef-1b78-4502-aa10-7e1438d62d23). ## Examples [!code-csharp[DP ObjectServices Concepts#DetachObjects](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Data/DP ObjectServices Concepts/CS/Source.cs#detachobjects)] [!code-vb[DP ObjectServices Concepts#DetachObjects](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Data/DP ObjectServices Concepts/VB/Source.vb#detachobjects)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果它打开的实体框架，则此方法关闭连接。This method closes the connection if it was opened by the Entity Framework. 后调用时，需要打开的连接，如执行查询或调用的操作方法，将导致异常。After is called, operations that require an open connection, such as executing a query or calling the method, will cause an exception. 执行不要求连接为打开状态的操作（如编写查询或附加对象），则不会引发异常。Operations that do not require an open connection, such as composing a query or attaching objects, will not cause an exception. 方法不会关闭任何显式打开的连接。The method does not close any explicitly opened connections. 限制的作用域内`using`块 (`Using`在 Visual Basic 中) 可确保正确释放资源。Limiting the scope of an within a `using` block (`Using` in Visual Basic) ensures that resources are correctly disposed. 有关详细信息，请参阅[管理连接和事务](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6659d2a-9a45-4e98-acaa-d7a8029e5b99)。For more information, see [Managing Connections and Transactions](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6659d2a-9a45-4e98-acaa-d7a8029e5b99). 方法调用`virtual`(`Overridable`在 Visual Basic 中)方法。The method calls the `virtual` (`Overridable` in Visual Basic) method.

Entity Data Model 工具生成概念模型中的每个方法。The Entity Data Model tools generate a method for each in the conceptual model. 这些方法调用一个强类型`ExecuteFunction`返回类型化。These methods call a strongly-typed `ExecuteFunction` to return a typed . 有关详细信息，请参阅[应用程序代码使用存储过程 （实体框架）](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/d13dd33f-fcf9-4e86-bd00-74bc31521536)。For more information, see [Application Code using Stored Procedures (Enity Framework)](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/d13dd33f-fcf9-4e86-bd00-74bc31521536). 函数的所有参数都都必需的参数数组中，并对照导入函数，包括该函数本身的类型的元数据检查所有类型。All parameters for the function are required in the parameters array and all types are checked against the metadata for the import function, including the type of the function itself. `null` 对于 CLR 值类型时，允许使用的值。`null` values are permitted for CLR value types. 参数验证由提供程序执行。Parameter validation is performed by the provider. 方法使用值。The method uses the value of . 因此，如果在对象上下文中已存在的对象，它将不加载从数据源。Therefore, if an object already exists in the object context, it will not be loaded from the data source.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用参数化命令可帮助抵御 SQL 注入攻击，这种攻击的攻击者会将命令“注入”SQL 语句，从而危及服务器的安全。Using parameterized commands helps guard against SQL injection attacks, in which an attacker "injects" a command into a SQL statement that compromises security on the server. 参数化的命令可抵御 SQL 注入攻击从而确保从外部源收到的值将作为仅，值和不是 SQL 语句的一部分传递。Parameterized commands guard against a SQL injection attack by guaranteeing that values received from an external source are passed as values only, and not part of the SQL statement. 因此，SQL 命令插入到值不会执行在数据源。As a result, SQL commands inserted into a value are not executed at the data source. 相反，只会将这些命令作为参数值来计算。Rather, they are evaluated only as a parameter value. 除具备安全优势，参数化的命令提供用于组织传递与 SQL 语句或存储过程的值的简便方法。In addition to the security benefits, parameterized commands provide a convenient method for organizing values passed with a SQL statement or to a stored procedure. `parameters` 值可以是 对象数组或参数值数组。The `parameters` value can be an array of objects or an array of parameter values. 如果只提供了值，数组对象创建基于数组中值的顺序。If only values are supplied, an array of objects are created based on the order of the values in the array. 如果存在当前事务，将在当前事务上下文中执行存储命令。The store command is executed in the context of the current transaction, if a current transaction exists. 有关详细信息，请参见:For more information, see: [直接执行存储命令](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/5708d0a2-3f76-4825-978a-d06ff5c4bb3d)和[Directly Executing Store Commands](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/5708d0a2-3f76-4825-978a-d06ff5c4bb3d) and [如何： 直接执行针对数据源的命令How to: Directly Execute Commands Against the Data Source](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/def3cc87-cfff-4dee-83cf-1a40c73a2d01)

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法使用现有的连接来执行直接针对数据源的任意命令。The method uses the existing connection to execute an arbitrary command directly against the data source. 如果存在当前事务，则将在当前事务的上下文中执行存储命令。The store command is executed in the context of the current transaction, if such a transaction exists. 调用 方法等效于调用 类的 方法，只是 返回实体，而 返回 中的属性值。Calling the method is equivalent to calling the method of the class, only returns entities and the returns property values in the . 调用与指定实体集名称，如果想要跟踪的结果。Call the with the specified entity set name, if you want for the results to be tracked. 语句，从而危及服务器的安全。Using parameterized commands helps guard against SQL injection attacks, in which an attacker "injects" a command into a SQL statement that compromises security on the server. 参数化的命令可抵御 SQL 注入攻击从而确保从外部源收到的值将作为仅，值和不是 SQL 语句的一部分传递。Parameterized commands guard against a SQL injection attack by guaranteeing that values received from an external source are passed as values only, and not part of the SQL statement. 因此，SQL 命令插入到值不会执行在数据源。As a result, SQL commands inserted into a value are not executed at the data source. 相反，只会将这些命令作为参数值来计算。Rather, they are evaluated only as a parameter value. 除具备安全优势，参数化的命令提供用于组织传递与 SQL 语句或存储过程的值的简便方法。In addition to the security benefits, parameterized commands provide a convenient method for organizing values passed with a SQL statement or to a stored procedure. `parameters` 值可以是 对象数组或参数值数组。The `parameters` value can be an array of objects or an array of parameter values. 如果只提供了值，数组对象创建基于数组中值的顺序。If only values are supplied, an array of remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法使用现有的连接来执行直接针对数据源的任意命令。The method uses the existing connection to execute an arbitrary command directly against the data source. 如果存在当前事务，则将在当前事务的上下文中执行存储命令。The store command is executed in the context of the current transaction, if such a transaction exists. 调用 方法等效于调用 类的 方法，只是 返回实体，而 返回 中的属性值。Calling the method is equivalent to calling the method of the class, only returns entities and the returns property values in the . 指定的实体集名称，如果想要作为实体进行跟踪的结果。Specify the entity set name, if you want for the results to be tracked as entities. 调用方法转换为实体对象时该读取器包含映射到指定的实体类型的数据行。Call method to translate a into entity objects when the reader contains data rows that map to the specified entity type. 使用参数化命令可帮助抵御 SQL 注入攻击，这种攻击的攻击者会将命令“注入”SQL 语句，从而危及服务器的安全。Using parameterized commands helps guard against SQL injection attacks, in which an attacker "injects" a command into a SQL statement that compromises security on the server. 参数化的命令可抵御 SQL 注入攻击从而确保从外部源收到的值将作为仅，值和不是 SQL 语句的一部分传递。Parameterized commands guard against a SQL injection attack by guaranteeing that values received from an external source are passed as values only, and not part of the SQL statement. 因此，SQL 命令插入到值不会执行在数据源。As a result, SQL commands inserted into a value are not executed at the data source. 相反，只会将这些命令作为参数值来计算。Rather, they are evaluated only as a parameter value. 除具备安全优势，参数化的命令提供用于组织传递与 SQL 语句或存储过程的值的简便方法。In addition to the security benefits, parameterized commands provide a convenient method for organizing values passed with a SQL statement or to a stored procedure. `parameters` 值可以是 对象数组或参数值数组。The `parameters` value can be an array of objects or an array of parameter values. 如果只提供了值，数组对象创建基于数组中值的顺序。If only values are supplied, an array of objects are created based on the order of the values in the array. 有关详细信息，请参见:For more information, see: [直接执行存储命令](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/5708d0a2-3f76-4825-978a-d06ff5c4bb3d)和[Directly Executing Store Commands](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/5708d0a2-3f76-4825-978a-d06ff5c4bb3d) and [如何： 直接执行针对数据源的命令How to: Directly Execute Commands Against the Data Source](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/def3cc87-cfff-4dee-83cf-1a40c73a2d01)

remarks.format: ## Remarks 必须调用方法来达成显式加载，当你使用 POCO 自定义数据类。The method must be called to achieve explicit loading when you are using POCO custom data classes. 在调用，可以通过源实体的导航属性访问相关的对象。After calling , the related object can be accessed through the navigation properties of the source entity. 要加载的属性指定由 LINQ 表达式，如简单的属性成员访问权限，格式必须为`(entity) => entity.PropertyName`，其中*PropertyName*是返回要加载的相关的对象的导航属性。The property to load is specified by a LINQ expression, which must be in the form of a simple property member access, as in `(entity) => entity.PropertyName`, where *PropertyName* is the navigation property that returns the related objects to be loaded. 如果使用其他形式的 LINQ 表达式，则会发生异常。An exception will occur if other forms of the LINQ expression are used. 当使用 POCO 自定义数据类，不能如由 Entity Data Model 工具生成的实体类型实例的显式加载相关的对象。When using POCO custom data classes, related objects cannot be explicitly loaded like instances of entity types that are generated by the Entity Data Model tools. 这是因为这些工具生成的导航属性返回或的相关对象时上调用。This is because the tools generate the navigation properties that return an or of related objects when is called on a . 仍可以通过设置使用延迟加载加载 POCO 实体属性`true`的实例上返回属性，或通过使用与预先加载方法.POCO entities can still be loaded by using lazy loading by setting the property to `true` on the instance of that is returned by the property, or by using eager loading with the method on the .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法具有两种用途，一种是允许使用数据源中的数据刷新对象上下文中的对象，另一种是作为解决冲突的机制。This method has the dual purpose of allowing objects in the object context to be refreshed with data from the data source, and being the mechanism by which conflicts can be resolved. 有关详细信息，请参阅[保存更改和管理并发](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b8378601-4f26-4a05-a24a-f50aeb68610e)。For more information, see [Saving Changes and Managing Concurrency](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b8378601-4f26-4a05-a24a-f50aeb68610e). 刷新对象的顺序具有不确定性。The order in which objects are refreshed is nondeterministic. 在调用 后，会始终使用数据源值更新对象的原始值，但是可能会也可能不会使用数据源值更新当前值。After is called, the object’s original values will always be updated with the data source value, but the current values might or might not be updated with the data source value. 这取决于 值。This depends on the value. 模式意味着应更新集合中的对象以匹配的数据源值。The mode means that the objects in the collection should be updated to match the data source values. 意味着，仅在对象上下文中的更改将会保持不变，即使数据源中进行了其他更改。 means that only the changes in the object context will be persisted, even if there have been other changes in the data source. 若要确保已由数据源端逻辑更新了对象，可以在调用 方法后，使用 调用 。To ensure that objects have been updated by data source-side logic, you can call with after you call the method.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 具有两种用途，一种是允许使用数据源中的数据刷新对象，另一种是作为解决冲突的机制。 has the dual purpose of allowing an object to be refreshed with data from the data source and being the mechanism by which conflicts can be resolved. 有关详细信息，请参阅[保存更改和管理并发](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b8378601-4f26-4a05-a24a-f50aeb68610e)。For more information, see [Saving Changes and Managing Concurrency](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b8378601-4f26-4a05-a24a-f50aeb68610e). 刷新对象的顺序具有不确定性。The order in which objects are refreshed is nondeterministic. 在调用 方法后，会始终使用数据源值更新对象的原始值，但是可能会也可能不会使用数据源值更新当前值。After the method is called, the object’s original values will always be updated with the data source value, but the current values might or might not be updated with the data source value. 这取决于 。This depends on the . 模式意味着应将对象更新为与数据源值匹配。The mode means that the object should be updated to match the data source values. 值意味着仅保持对象上下文中的更改，即使数据源中发生了其他更改也是如此。The value means that only the changes in the object context will be persisted, even if there have been other changes in the data source. 若要确保已由数据源端逻辑更新了对象，可以在调用 方法后，使用 值调用 方法。To ensure that an object has been updated by data source-side logic, you can call the method with the value after you call the method. ## Examples 此示例基于[AdventureWorks 销售模型](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/f16cd988-673f-4376-b034-129ca93c7832)。This example is based on the [AdventureWorks Sales Model](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/f16cd988-673f-4376-b034-129ca93c7832). 此示例尝试保存更改，这可能导致并发冲突。The example tries to save changes, and this may cause a concurrency conflict. 然后，此示例演示如何通过在重新保存更改前刷新对象上下文来解决并发冲突。Then it shows how to resolve the concurrency conflict by refreshing the object context before re-saving changes. [!code-csharp[DP ObjectServices Concepts#Concurrency](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Data/DP ObjectServices Concepts/CS/Source.cs#concurrency)] [!code-vb[DP ObjectServices Concepts#Concurrency](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Data/DP ObjectServices Concepts/VB/Source.vb#concurrency)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 若要确保已由数据源端逻辑更新了客户端上的对象，可以在调用 后，使用 值调用 方法。To ensure that objects on the client have been updated by data source-side logic, you can call the method with the value after you call . 有关详细信息，请参阅[保存更改和管理并发](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b8378601-4f26-4a05-a24a-f50aeb68610e)。For more information, see [Saving Changes and Managing Concurrency](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b8378601-4f26-4a05-a24a-f50aeb68610e). 在事务中进行操作。 operates within a transaction. 将回滚该事务并引发异常，如果任何脏无法持久化对象。 will roll back that transaction and throw an exception if any of the dirty objects cannot be persisted. 如果发生了开放式并发冲突，则引发 。If an optimistic concurrency violation has occurred, an is thrown. 可以通过以下方式解决开放式并发冲突，即捕获该冲突，使用 或 值调用 方法，然后再次调用 。You can resolve an optimistic concurrency violation by catching it, calling the method with the or value, and then calling again. 有关详细信息，请参阅[如何： 管理对象上下文中的数据并发](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/25ffe70d-ce97-4f0a-8ae0-22b7c40f748a)。For more information, see [How to: Manage Data Concurrency in the Object Context](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/25ffe70d-ce97-4f0a-8ae0-22b7c40f748a). ## Examples 此示例基于[AdventureWorks 销售模型](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/f16cd988-673f-4376-b034-129ca93c7832)。This example is based on the [AdventureWorks Sales Model](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/f16cd988-673f-4376-b034-129ca93c7832). 此示例尝试保存更改，这可能导致并发冲突。This example tries to save changes, which may cause a concurrency conflict. 然后，此示例演示如何通过在重新保存更改前刷新对象上下文来解决并发冲突。Then, it demonstrates how to resolve the concurrency conflict by refreshing the object context before re-saving changes. [!code-csharp[DP ObjectServices Concepts#Concurrency](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Data/DP ObjectServices Concepts/CS/Source.cs#concurrency)] [!code-vb[DP ObjectServices Concepts#Concurrency](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Data/DP ObjectServices Concepts/VB/Source.vb#concurrency)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 尝试从 检索具有指定 的对象。 tries to retrieve an object that has the specified from the . 如果该对象当前尚未加载到对象上下文中，则会执行查询以尝试从数据源返回该对象。If the object is currently not loaded into the object context, a query is executed in an attempt to return the object from the data source. 有关详细信息，请参阅[对象查询](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/0768033c-876f-471d-85d5-264884349276)。For more information, see [Object Queries](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/0768033c-876f-471d-85d5-264884349276). 使用 方法可避免处理在无法找到对象时由 引发的 。Use the method to avoid handling the raised by when the object cannot be found. 此方法将返回状态为 的对象。This method will return objects in the state. 临时键无法用于从数据源返回对象。A temporary key cannot be used to return an object from the data source. 方法适用于标准.NET`TryParse`模式方法，从而返回`false`时捕获。The method applies the standard .NET `TryParse` pattern for the method, returning `false` when the is caught. ## Examples 本主题中的示例基于[AdventureWorks 销售模型](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/f16cd988-673f-4376-b034-129ca93c7832)。The example in this topic is based on the [AdventureWorks Sales Model](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/f16cd988-673f-4376-b034-129ca93c7832). 该示例为具有给定类型的实体创建 ，然后尝试通过键检索实体。The example creates an for an entity of the given type and then tries to retrieve an entity by key.
